context.description: TCPIPClientOutput node Use the TCPIPClientOutput node to create a client connection to a raw TCP/IP socket, and to send data over that connection to an external application.
Properties navigator This displays the node properties. Configure the node by selecting the properties and setting their values. Mandatory properties are marked with an asterisk.

topic.label: TCPIPClientOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPClientOutput node

context.description: Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both

topic.label: TCPIPClientOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPClientOutput node

context.description: Basic page Enter the host name, port number and timeout information for the TCPIPClientOutput node.

topic.label: TCPIPClientOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPClientOutput node

context.description: Request page Enter the location in the message tree of the data, host name and port number for the TCPIPClientOutput node.

topic.label: TCPIPClientOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPClientOutput node

context.description: Advanced page Enter advanced configuration information for the TCPIPClientOutput node: for example, whether the TCP/IP connection is closed after a record is sent.

topic.label: TCPIPClientOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPClientOutput node

context.description: Records and Elements page Specify how and to what extent you want your TCPIP records and elements to be processed.

topic.label: TCPIPClientOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPClientOutput node

context.description: Validation page Set these properties if you want the MRM parser to validate the body of messages using the dictionary generated from the message set, and choose the failure action to be taken.

topic.label: TCPIPClientOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPClientOutput node
